00053 typedef struct xnarchtcb {      /* Per-thread arch-dependent block */
00054 
00055     /* User mode side */
00056     struct task_struct *user_task;      /* Shadowed user-space task */
00057     struct task_struct *active_task;    /* Active user-space task */
00058     struct thread_struct *tsp;  /* Pointer to the active thread struct (&ts or &user->thread). */
00059 
00060     /* Kernel mode side */
00061     struct thread_struct ts;    /* Holds kernel-based thread context. */
00062 #ifdef CONFIG_XENO_HW_FPU
00063     /* We only care for basic FPU handling in kernel-space; Altivec
00064        and SPE are not available to kernel-based nucleus threads. */
00065     rthal_fpenv_t fpuenv  __attribute__ ((aligned (16)));
00066     rthal_fpenv_t *fpup;        /* Pointer to the FPU backup area */
00067     struct task_struct *user_fpu_owner;
00068     unsigned long user_fpu_owner_prev_msr;
00069     /* Pointer the the FPU owner in userspace:
00070        - NULL for RT K threads,
00071        - last_task_used_math for Linux US threads (only current or NULL when MP)
00072        - current for RT US threads.
00073     */
00074 #define xnarch_fpu_ptr(tcb)     ((tcb)->fpup)
00075 #else /* !CONFIG_XENO_HW_FPU */
00076 #define xnarch_fpu_ptr(tcb)     NULL
00077 #endif /* CONFIG_XENO_HW_FPU */
00078 
00079     unsigned stacksize;         /* Aligned size of stack (bytes) */
00080     unsigned long *stackbase;   /* Stack space */
00081 
00082     /* Init block */
00083     struct xnthread *self;
00084     int imask;
00085     const char *name;
00086     void (*entry)(void *cookie);
00087     void *cookie;
00088 
00089 } xnarchtcb_t;

00167 static inline void xnarch_leave_root (xnarchtcb_t *rootcb)
00168 
00169 {
00170     rthal_declare_cpuid;
00171 
00172     rthal_load_cpuid();
00173 
00174     /* rthal_cpu_realtime is only tested for the current processor,
00175        and always inside a critical section. */
00176     __set_bit(cpuid,&rthal_cpu_realtime);
00177     /* Remember the preempted Linux task pointer. */
00178     rootcb->user_task = rootcb->active_task = rthal_current_host_task(cpuid);
00179     rootcb->tsp = &rootcb->user_task->thread;
00180 #ifdef CONFIG_XENO_HW_FPU
00181     rootcb->user_fpu_owner = rthal_get_fpu_owner(rootcb->user_task);
00182     /* So that xnarch_save_fpu() will operate on the right FPU area. */
00183     rootcb->fpup = (rootcb->user_fpu_owner
00184                     ? (rthal_fpenv_t *)&rootcb->user_fpu_owner->thread.fpr[0]
00185                     : NULL);
00186 #endif /* CONFIG_XENO_HW_FPU */
00187 }

00190 {
00191     __clear_bit(xnarch_current_cpu(),&rthal_cpu_realtime);
00192 }

00194 static inline void xnarch_switch_to (xnarchtcb_t *out_tcb,
00195                                      xnarchtcb_t *in_tcb)
00196 {
00197     struct task_struct *prev = out_tcb->active_task;
00198     struct task_struct *next = in_tcb->user_task;
00199 
00200     in_tcb->active_task = next ?: prev;
00201 
00202     if (next && next != prev) /* Switch to new user-space thread? */
00203         {
00204         struct mm_struct *mm = next->active_mm;
00205 
00206         /* Switch the mm context.*/
00207 
00208 #ifdef CONFIG_ALTIVEC
00209         asm volatile (
00210                       "dssall;\n"
00211                       : : );
00212 #endif /* CONFIG_ALTIVEC */
00213         
00214         if (!cpu_isset(smp_processor_id(), mm->cpu_vm_mask)) {
00215             cpu_set(smp_processor_id(), mm->cpu_vm_mask);
00216         }
00217         
00218         if (cur_cpu_spec->cpu_features & CPU_FTR_SLB) {
00219             switch_slb(next, mm);
00220         }
00221         else {
00222             switch_stab(next, mm);
00223         }
00224         
00225         flush_tlb_pending();
00226         }
00227 
00228     rthal_thread_switch(out_tcb->tsp, in_tcb->tsp, 
00229                     in_tcb->user_task == NULL ? 1 : 0);
00230     
00231     barrier();
00232 }

00264 asmlinkage static void xnarch_thread_trampoline (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00265 
00266 {
00267     rthal_local_irq_restore(!!tcb->imask);
00268     xnpod_welcome_thread(tcb->self);
00269     tcb->entry(tcb->cookie);
00270     xnpod_delete_thread(tcb->self);
00271 }

00273 static inline void xnarch_init_thread (xnarchtcb_t *tcb,
00274                                        void (*entry)(void *),
00275                                        void *cookie,
00276                                        int imask,
00277                                        struct xnthread *thread,
00278                                        char *name)
00279 {
00280     unsigned long *ksp, flags;
00281     struct pt_regs *childregs;
00282 
00283     rthal_local_irq_flags_hw(flags);
00284 
00285     ksp = (unsigned long *)((unsigned long)tcb->stackbase + tcb->stacksize - RTHAL_SWITCH_FRAME_SIZE - 32);
00286     childregs = (struct pt_regs *)ksp;
00287     memset(childregs,0,sizeof(*childregs));
00288     childregs->nip = ((unsigned long *)&rthal_thread_trampoline)[0];
00289     childregs->gpr[2] = ((unsigned long *)&rthal_thread_trampoline)[1];
00290     childregs->gpr[14] = flags & ~(MSR_EE | MSR_FP);
00291     childregs->gpr[15] = ((unsigned long *)&xnarch_thread_trampoline)[0]; /* lr = entry addr. */
00292     childregs->gpr[16] = ((unsigned long *)&xnarch_thread_trampoline)[1]; /* r2 = TOC base. */
00293     childregs->gpr[17] = (unsigned long)tcb;
00294     tcb->ts.ksp = (unsigned long)childregs - STACK_FRAME_OVERHEAD;
00295     if (cpu_has_feature(CPU_FTR_SLB)) { /* from process.c/copy_thread */
00296             unsigned long sp_vsid = get_kernel_vsid(tcb->ts.ksp);
00297             
00298             sp_vsid <<= SLB_VSID_SHIFT;
00299             sp_vsid |= SLB_VSID_KERNEL;
00300             if (cpu_has_feature(CPU_FTR_16M_PAGE))
00301                     sp_vsid |= SLB_VSID_L;
00302             
00303             tcb->ts.ksp_vsid = sp_vsid;
00304     }
00305     
00306     tcb->entry = entry;
00307     tcb->cookie = cookie;
00308     tcb->self = thread;
00309     tcb->imask = imask;
00310     tcb->name = name;
00311 }

00325 static inline void xnarch_init_fpu (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00326 
00327 {
00328 #ifdef CONFIG_XENO_HW_FPU
00329     /* Initialize the FPU for an emerging kernel-based RT thread. This
00330        must be run on behalf of the emerging thread. */
00331     memset(&tcb->fpuenv,0,sizeof(tcb->fpuenv));
00332     rthal_init_fpu(&tcb->fpuenv);
00333 #endif /* CONFIG_XENO_HW_FPU */
00334 }
00335 
00336 static inline void xnarch_save_fpu (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00337 
00338 {
00339 #ifdef CONFIG_XENO_HW_FPU
00340 
00341     if(tcb->fpup)
00342         {
00343         rthal_save_fpu(tcb->fpup);
00344 
00345         if(tcb->user_fpu_owner && tcb->user_fpu_owner->thread.regs)
00346             {
00347             tcb->user_fpu_owner_prev_msr = tcb->user_fpu_owner->thread.regs->msr;
00348             tcb->user_fpu_owner->thread.regs->msr &= ~MSR_FP;
00349             }
00350         }   
00351 
00352 #endif /* CONFIG_XENO_HW_FPU */
00353 }
00354 
00355 static inline void xnarch_restore_fpu (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00356 
00357 {
00358 #ifdef CONFIG_XENO_HW_FPU
00359 
00360     if(tcb->fpup)
00361         {
00362         rthal_restore_fpu(tcb->fpup);
00363 
00364         /* Note: Only enable FP in MSR, if it was enabled when we saved the
00365          * fpu state. We might have preempted Linux when it had disabled FP
00366          * for the thread, but not yet set last_task_used_math to NULL 
00367          */
00368         if(tcb->user_fpu_owner && 
00369                         tcb->user_fpu_owner->thread.regs &&
00370                         ((tcb->user_fpu_owner_prev_msr & MSR_FP) != 0))
00371             tcb->user_fpu_owner->thread.regs->msr |= MSR_FP;
00372         }   
00373 
00374     /* FIXME: We restore FPU "as it was" when Xenomai preempted Linux,
00375        whereas we could be much lazier. */
00376     if(tcb->user_task)
00377         rthal_disable_fpu();
00378 
00379 #endif /* CONFIG_XENO_HW_FPU */
00380 }

00396     /* Must be followed by xnarch_init_thread(). */
00397 }

00399 #define xnarch_alloc_stack(tcb,stacksize) \
00400 ({ \
00401     int __err; \
00402     (tcb)->stacksize = stacksize; \
00403     if (stacksize == 0) { \
00404         (tcb)->stackbase = NULL; \
00405         __err = 0; \
00406     } else { \
00407         (tcb)->stackbase = xnmalloc(stacksize); \
00408         __err = (tcb)->stackbase ? 0 : -ENOMEM; \
00409     } \
00410     __err; \
00411 })
00412 
00413 #define xnarch_free_stack(tcb) \
00414 do { \
00415       if ((tcb)->stackbase) \
00416           xnfree((tcb)->stackbase); \
00417 } while(0)

00419 #endif /* XENO_THREAD_MODULE */

00443 static inline void xnarch_grab_xirqs (void (*handler)(unsigned irq))
00444 
00445 {
00446     unsigned irq;
00447 
00448     for (irq = 0; irq < IPIPE_NR_XIRQS; irq++)
00449         rthal_virtualize_irq(rthal_current_domain,
00450                              irq,
00451                              handler,
00452                              NULL,
00453                              IPIPE_DYNAMIC_MASK);
00454 
00455     /* On this arch, the decrementer trap is not an external IRQ but
00456        it is instead mapped to a virtual IRQ, so we must grab it
00457        individually. */
00458 
00459     rthal_virtualize_irq(rthal_current_domain,
00460                          RTHAL_TIMER_IRQ,
00461                          handler,
00462                          NULL,
00463                          IPIPE_DYNAMIC_MASK);
00464 }

00466 static inline void xnarch_lock_xirqs (rthal_pipeline_stage_t *ipd, int cpuid)
00467 
00468 {
00469     unsigned irq;
00470 
00471     for (irq = 0; irq < IPIPE_NR_XIRQS; irq++)
00472         {
00473         switch (irq)
00474             {
00475 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00476             case RTHAL_CRITICAL_IPI:
00477 
00478                 /* Never lock out this one. */
00479                 continue;
00480 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00481 
00482             default:
00483 
00484                 rthal_lock_irq(ipd,cpuid,irq);
00485             }
00486         }
00487 
00488     rthal_lock_irq(ipd,cpuid,RTHAL_TIMER_IRQ);
00489 }
00490 
00491 static inline void xnarch_unlock_xirqs (rthal_pipeline_stage_t *ipd, int cpuid)
00492 
00493 {
00494     unsigned irq;
00495 
00496     for (irq = 0; irq < IPIPE_NR_XIRQS; irq++)
00497         {
00498         switch (irq)
00499             {
00500 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00501             case RTHAL_CRITICAL_IPI:
00502 
00503                 continue;
00504 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00505 
00506             default:
00507 
00508                 rthal_unlock_irq(ipd,irq);
00509             }
00510         }
00511 
00512     rthal_unlock_irq(ipd,RTHAL_TIMER_IRQ);
00513 }

00519 static inline void xnarch_program_timer_shot (unsigned long delay) {
00520     /* Even though some architectures may use a 64 bits delay here, we
00521        voluntarily limit to 32 bits, 4 billions ticks should be enough
00522        for now. Would a timer needs more, an extra call to the tick
00523        handler would simply occur after 4 billions ticks.  Since the
00524        timebase value is used to express CPU ticks on the PowerPC
00525        port, there is no need to rescale the delay value. */
00526     rthal_timer_program_shot(delay);
00527 }

00570 unsigned long xnarch_calibrate_timer (void)
00571 
00572 {
00573 #if CONFIG_XENO_HW_TIMER_LATENCY != 0
00574     return xnarch_ns_to_tsc(CONFIG_XENO_HW_TIMER_LATENCY) ?: 1;
00575 #else /* CONFIG_XENO_HW_TIMER_LATENCY unspecified. */
00576     /* Compute the time needed to program the decrementer in aperiodic
00577        mode. The return value is expressed in timebase ticks. */
00578     return xnarch_ns_to_tsc(rthal_timer_calibrate()) ?: 1;
00579 #endif /* CONFIG_XENO_HW_TIMER_LATENCY != 0 */
00580 }
00581 
00582 int xnarch_calibrate_sched (void)
00583 
00584 {
00585     nktimerlat = xnarch_calibrate_timer();
00586 
00587     if (!nktimerlat)
00588         return -ENODEV;
00589 
00590     nkschedlat = xnarch_ns_to_tsc(xnarch_get_sched_latency());
00591 
00592     return 0;
00593 }

00595 static inline int xnarch_init (void)
00596 
00597 {
00598     int err;
00599 
00600 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00601     /* The HAL layer also sets the same CPU affinity so that both
00602        modules keep their execution sequence on SMP boxen. */
00603     set_cpus_allowed(current,cpumask_of_cpu(0));
00604 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00605 
00606     err = xnarch_calibrate_sched();
00607 
00608     if (err)
00609         return err;
00610 
00611     xnarch_escalation_virq = rthal_alloc_virq();
00612 
00613     if (xnarch_escalation_virq == 0)
00614         return -ENOSYS;
00615 
00616     rthal_virtualize_irq(&rthal_domain,
00617                          xnarch_escalation_virq,
00618                          (void (*)(unsigned))&xnpod_schedule_handler,
00619                          NULL,
00620                          IPIPE_HANDLE_MASK);
00621
